availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Brother of Jane Wray. Was a farmer and merchant in Wayne County. In 1860, both George A. Caldwell and Thomas J. Caldwell were living with him, George as a farm laborer, and Thomas a merchant clerk.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, “John Scott Wray (February 7, 1809-April 18, 1864),” Memorial #30651590, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=30651590 (accessed June 3, 2017); Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Wayne, Mill Springs, p. 120.
